title: Man Utd ready to deliver Solskjaer six top signings before next season starts
text:
Solskjaer needs reinforcements (Picture: ANP Sport via Getty)

Manchester United chiefs accept their playing squad requires major surgery and plan to deliver six new signings to Ole Gunnar Solskjaer by the start of next season.

There’s a sense of urgency about the latest recruitment drive, with United sat just two points above the relegation zone after nine games following the club’s worst start to a season in 30 years, and the hierarchy are prepared to put their hands in their pockets to deliver players who are ready-made for a title challenge to stop them slipping further behind rivals Liverpool and Manchester City.

Two strikers, two central midfielders, a centre-back and a left-back will be targeted, according to the Daily Mail.

Solskjaer’s plans to phase out the old guard are backed by the club and they are willing to spend big – as they did with £80million Harry Maguire this summer – for the right targets.

While January is not viewed as the ideal month to conduct business, there is a realisation that strengthening needs to begin immediately.

One area of particular urgency is the striker position.

After Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez headed to Inter Milan in the summer, United have been forced to use teenage forward Mason Greenwood with growing frequency due to injuries to Marcus Rashford and Anthony Martial and there’s an acceptance that a new face needs to arrive in the winter transfer window.

Juventus forward Mario Mandzukic is one such target with Lyon’s Moussa Dembele also being considered.

In midfield, Atletico Madrid’s Saul Niguez has been monitored in the past, while Leicester’s James Maddison is thought highly of by coaching staff at Old Trafford.
